title: Use XML Tags for Structure
description: Claude responds exceptionally well to XML-structured prompts
rule: Structure your prompt using XML tags like <context>, <task>, <instructions>, <constraints>, and <output>. Claude parses and follows XML structure reliably.
examples: You are a technical writer. Write documentation for the following function. {code} Provide the documentation in markdown format.

title: Request Thinking in Tags
description: Enable explicit reasoning with thinking tags
rule: Ask Claude to show its reasoning in <thinking> tags before providing the final answer: 'First, show your reasoning in <thinking> tags, then provide your answer.'
examples: Analyze this problem. First show your step-by-step reasoning in <thinking> tags, then provide your final answer outside the tags.

title: Set Explicit Constraints
rule: List constraints explicitly using 'You MUST:' and 'You MUST NOT:' followed by specific requirements. Claude follows explicit boundaries reliably.
examples:
You MUST:
- Only use information from the provided documents
- Cite sources for each claim
- Keep the response under 500 words

You MUST NOT:
- Make assumptions beyond the given data
- Include personal opinions

title: Wrap Documents Properly
rule: When providing documents for analysis, wrap them in <document> tags with identifiers, then reference them explicitly: 'Based on the document above...'
examples:
<document id="contract">
{contract_text}
</document>

Based on the contract above, identify any clauses related to termination.

title: Use Examples with Tags
rule: When providing examples, wrap them in <example> tags with clear input/output delineation. This helps Claude understand the expected format.
examples:
<examples>
<example>
<input>Hello world</input>
<output>HELLO WORLD</output>
</example>
<example>
<input>Test string</input>
<output>TEST STRING</output>
</example>
</examples>

Now process: <input>{user_input}</input>

title: Prefill Assistant Response
description: Guide the response format by starting the assistant message
rule: When using the API, you can prefill the assistant's response to guide the format. Start with '{' for JSON, or the beginning of your expected structure.

title: Long Context Best Practices
description: Optimize prompts for long document processing
rule: For long documents, place key instructions both at the beginning AND end of the prompt. Put the most important context at the start, with specific questions at the end.
